benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/block - Block a bundle

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC13, TC14, TC15) exercise creation with required and optional fields.
Invalid Payload / Validation: Malformed body (TC08), invalid requestedDate (TC11), invalid bundleId format (TC06) and missing required header/body (TC09, TC10) are covered.
Authentication/Authorization: Invalid authentication token scenario (TC18) and missing createdBy header (TC09) are present.
Error Handling: Not-found cases (TC05, TC07) and service/dependency failures (TC17, TC28) are included.
Large Payloads / Limits: Stress/large payload test included (TC16) covering size-limit behaviour.
Concurrency & Duplicate State Handling: Concurrent requests test (TC22) covers concurrent creation and system behavior under parallel requests.
Security: Injection (TC19) and XSS (TC20) tests included for input sanitization and validation.
Response Content Validation: Several scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04) assert response code 201 and response body structure/fields per BlockingState.
Integration & Consistency: Cross-system consistency (TC29) and regression/compatibility checks (TC23, TC24) are present.
Performance: Response-time under normal and peak load (TC25, TC26) and resource utilization for bulk ops (TC27) are present.
gaps: Duplicate Submission / Idempotency: No explicit scenario for duplicate submissions (same payload re-sent) to check idempotency/duplicate handling or deduplication semantics.
Internal Server Error (500) Simulation: There is no explicit test for an internal server error (e.g., DB failure leading to 500) distinct from dependency errors (502/503).
Response Headers and Location: No tests validate response headers (e.g., Location, Content-Type nuances, caching-related headers) or other HTTP metadata that may be required.

Precise Schema/Field-level Validation: While response structure is asserted, there are no exhaustive tests for every BlockingState field (e.g., boolean flags isBlockChange/isBlockBilling/isBlockEntitlement combinations, invalid enumerations, or boundary value checks per-field beyond length).

Duplicate / Conflicting Blocking States: No scenario that attempts to create conflicting or overlapping blocking states for the same bundle/time to validate business rules (e.g., precedence, merge, or rejection).
Id Pattern Edge Cases: Only an invalid-format test exists; boundary cases around accepted UUID variants or surprising characters are not enumerated.
Ambiguous Error Codes: Some scenarios (e.g., missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy) allow either 400 or 401—there are no tests asserting the expected standardized error code and message format consistently.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for API rate limiting or throttling behavior during burst requests (relevant to POST in heavy load contexts).
Caching & Related Headers: Although more relevant to GET, there are no checks for caching or related headers which sometimes matter for POST responses in proxies.
recommendations: Add a Duplicate Submission test: re-send the same POST payload and assert whether the API returns 201 with a new resource, a 409/200/304, or otherwise follows documented idempotency semantics.
Add a 500 Internal Server Error simulation: induce a DB failure or mock internal exception to ensure API surfaces 500 and proper error body for server errors.
Validate response headers: include assertions for Content-Type, Location (if applicable), and any other expected HTTP headers.
Add field-level validation tests: enumerate BlockingState field permutations (booleans, enumerations, date/time edge cases) and invalid values per-field to ensure precise schema validation.
Test conflicting blocking states and business rules: create overlapping/contradictory blocking states to verify acceptance, rejection, or merging behavior.

Tighten error-code expectations: replace ambiguous acceptance of 400/401 with the documented expected response (or add distinct tests for each to lock behavior), and assert standardized error message formats.
Expand id pattern tests: include additional invalid UUID variants and boundary cases to ensure robust path parameter validation.
Add rate-limiting/throttle tests: simulate bursts to verify how the POST endpoint behaves under throttle limits and what status codes are returned.
Add a test for duplicate pluginProperty/empty pluginProperty handling and for the presence/absence of optional headers impacting auditing fields.
